ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We learned five different types of traditional dances in addition to a movement studies piece we created in small groups. Throughout the semester we also had improvising sessions where we created something alone or in groups.
How to work with a group, how to teach and be taught
I learned a lot of traditional dances in west Africa, specifically Burkina Faso, Sierre Leone, Mali, etc.
We gained knowledge of traditional West African Dance all the way to its modern form, both in practice and in theory.

We learned traditional West African dance forms and skills! This included both movement and rhythms, although it extended far beyond West Africa; Professor Coulibaly often talked about the universality of dance as a form of expression.
Excelent class! One of the best I have taken at Yale and what I learned has sticked with me in my daily life.
i gained insights into rhythm and dance in West Africa.
I developed a deeper understanding of the movements, rhythms, and cultural traditions of certain ethnic groups in West Africa.
I learned about the history and current practice of African Dance through academic readings, discussions, and embodied practice. What I learned enhanced other styles of dance that I do.
How to listen carefully for signals in African music and how to appreciate rhythm.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: very doable readings, Professor Coulibaly is a very patient teacher, and he moves at a pace that is doable for newcomers and still manages to challenge more experienced dancers. No weaknesses!

There isn't any progress report or way to measure how the class is going. The first and last grade I will receive in this course will be the final grade. I have no idea how it's going to go. I wish that the midterm paper had more structure and more of a rubric.
Professor is amazing. Weakness was that the class time was long

Everything was pretty good in terms of learning the dance. In terms of improvement, I would give a little more direction with the readings. Some of the readings were very long and we weren't sure what exactly we were supposed to get out of the reading.

Very fun to have a class in which you get to stretch, move your body, and experience a new form of dance. Strong class in that it really prioritizes the dance and choreography and getting comfortable with movement. Weakness may be a lack of clarity about assignments/syllabus, but that didn't really impact the enjoyment of the class.
Only strengths!!! Truly one of my favorite classes I've taken at Yale. Professor Coulibaly created a wonderful and supportive environment.
It was very difficult to hear the professor speaking with his mask on.

Out of all my courses this semester, I got the most feedback from this one because Professor would always provide suggestions and/or comments either during class or on assignments outside of class. I wish we had more class bonding activities because at the end of the semester I still did not know a lot of the other kids, considering there were only about 20 of us altogether. Lastly, I think it would've been nice if we had incorporated more videos (and less readings) into our class curriculum.

The time dancing in class is very instructive and interesting. The discussions were also interesting and I appreciated the flexibility of the written assignements. The academic vs dance breakdown of class time was perfect.
The professor is the course's greatest strength. He was passionate about his work and also very patient with us when we had difficulty learning some of the dances.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: ABSOLUTELY! Learning can come in many different forms; physical learning is just as important as the readings we do in class. What a privilege it is to go to class twice a week and learn from Professor Coulibaly in such an encouraging environment. West African dance is certainly challenging and I feel like I've stretched myself as a dancer and scholar through this class.
Yes! I think that this is a great course that anyone who has a slight interest in dance should take. I found that going to class was fun and stress-relieving.
A MUST-TAKE if you get in. Professor Coulibaly is a great professor even during COVID-19.
Yes! A must take. Professor is great.

I would highly recommend this course if you are looking for a chill 4th/5th course. I had a lot of fun learning the dances, reading the books, and performing the final dance in collaboration with all of the other students.
Yes! Very fun and enlightening course that is different than anything else you will take at Yale.
Yes yes yes!!! I would recommend this to anyone interested in dance, as well as simply anyone. It was a class like no other, and it energized and brightened my day after each class.
Yes, this class is very interesting and doesn't require much of your time outside of class.

I would absolutely recommend this course, even if you think you are someone who "can't dance." That was me at the start of the semester, Professor Coulibaly gives very good and personalized feedback, as long as you are willing to learn. Very fun class.
Yes!
Yes I would! I would especially recommend taking this with a friend! It makes the class even more fun.
Absolutely! If you enjoy dancing, no matter your level, sign up for this course. It is well designed for all dancer-levels and Professor Coulibaly is excellent at giving constructive feedback.
I definitely would!!! This was a very engaging and fun course. It wasn't too stressful, and I got my weekly exercise from the dancing.
